title: Investing in Space: Rocket Lab stock leads the sector in year-to-date gains
summary: At the beginning of this year, I included a breakout space stock as one of the three things I’m watching for in 2023. Just past the halfway point we have strong contenders for that title, led by Rocket Lab and followed by Redwire and Mynaric, with the top five rounded out by Telesat and BlackSky.

title: Northrop Grumman planning Cygnus upgrades
summary: Northrop Grumman is planning upgrades to its Cygnus cargo vehicle, such as increased payload capacity, to support both the International Space Station and future commercial space stations.

title: Probing the origin and evolution of water-rich asteroids
summary: More than half the work of the Emirates Mission to the Asteroid Belt is expected to be performed by UAE companies.

title: Northrop Grumman Reassessing Government Fixed Price Contracts After Loss on HALO
summary: Northrop Grumman is reconsidering when to sign fixed price contracts with the government after experiencing a $36 million loss on NASA’s Habitation and Logistics Outpost. Company head Kathy Warden told […]

title: SpaceX set for launch of the Intelsat communications satellite
summary: SpaceX is set for a midnight launch to send a communications satellite to geostationary transfer orbit for Intelsat. The two-hour launch window...

title: CSMC Hires NASA Astronaut As Executive VP Of Strategy
summary: The Canadian Space Mining Corporation (CSMC) has hired NASA Astronaut and Geophysicist Dr. Andrew J. Feustel to be their Executive Vice President of Strategy.

title: ULA Stacks Atlas V For Next National Security Launch
summary: United Launch Alliance (ULA) has stacked a Atlas V 551 rocket at SLC-41 on Cape Canaveral Space Force Station ahead of their next national security launch.

title: Airbus and Voyager Space Announce Commercial Space Station Partnership
summary:
US-based startup Voyager Space and Airbus Defence and Space have announced an agreement to develop, build, and operate Starlab, a commercial space station. The pair aim to offer the station that as a destination in low Earth orbit for US and European astronauts following the retirement of the International Space Station. The agreement announced on […]
The post Airbus and Voyager Space Announce Commercial Space Station Partnership appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: U.S. intelligence agency selects vendors for space debris tracking project
summary: The Intelligence Advanced Research Projects Activity selected four vendors to develop technologies and new approaches for tracking small debris objects in space.

title: Voyager Space Partners With AirBus To Develop StarLab Commercial Space Stations
summary: Voyager Space and Airbus Defence and Space have announced a groundbreaking partnership for the joint development of the StarLab commercial space stations.
